PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Mrs. Lillie Wilcox, 1849 Linton Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 4, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you believe that Negro communities actually choose their leaders or do they accept the leadership, which 'the powers-that-be' select and 'hand' to them?" answer reads: "I think that the Negro community selects its leaders."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Lillie Wilcox wearing ribboned brooch, eyeglasses, hat, and light colored gloves, standing in front of garbage can, possibly on Fifth Avenue, with rug store in background, Downtown
